Expectation1: Attending children's school events and activities
Situation1: Children are about to finish school, and the mother should pick them up
Situation2: They plan to attend a family ceremony, making sure to arrive on time and wear appropriate attire.
Story: The clock on the wall ticked louder than usual as I glanced at the time. My children would be finishing school in half an hour, and I had promised them I’d be there at the gate, just like every other day. Their faces always lit up when they spotted me, and I cherished those moments. But today was also the day of my cousin’s puja, a family ceremony that everyone expected me to attend. My mother-in-law had called twice already, reminding me to wear my saree and arrive early to help with the preparations. The thought of disappointing my family weighed heavily on me, but so did the idea of my children waiting, scanning the crowd for me, only to find I wasn’t there. My heart pounded as I stood in the hallway, torn between the sacred rituals of my faith and the everyday rituals of motherhood, feeling the pressure of both worlds closing in.
